title: Fines, filthy jokes and fishing - life inside Warren Gatland's Wales camp
text:
On the Thursday before Wales’ crunch World Cup clash with Australia – a game two years in the making – Warren Gatland invited a section of the media for drinks at his team’s plush Tokyo hotel.

In years gone by that sort of invitation might have been commonplace, but it is certainly not in professional sport in 2019. Talk over drinks was of rugby, but also of the way of life in Japan and how Wales and their travelling media were adapting to the culture. Gatland was on fine form and, as he left, he seemed to take extra pleasure in playfully mocking one of the journalists present for their extracurricular activities.

He did so with a smile and you can tell all is well in Gatland’s world when that...
